references.paper_title: Global Instance Tracking: Locating Target More Like Humans
references.reason: This paper introduces a new benchmark dataset for global instance tracking, which is directly relevant to the vision-language tracking (VLT) task addressed in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Towards More Flexible and Accurate Object Tracking with Natural Language: Algorithms and Benchmark
references.reason: This paper introduces the TNL2K benchmark dataset, which is used for evaluating the MemVLT model and is a key dataset in the field of vision-language tracking.

references.paper_title: LaSOT: A High-quality Benchmark for Large-scale Single Object Tracking
references.reason: This paper presents LaSOT, a large-scale benchmark dataset widely used in the single object tracking (SOT) and vision-language tracking (VLT) communities, which is extensively used in evaluating the proposed MemVLT tracker.

references.paper_title: Siamese Natural Language Tracker: Tracking by Natural Language Descriptions with Siamese Trackers
references.reason: This paper introduces a pioneering approach to vision-language tracking (VLT) that uses siamese networks, influencing the design of many subsequent VLT methods, including the MemVLT.

references.paper_title: Why there are complementary learning systems in the hippocampus and neocortex: insights from the successes and failures of connectionist models of learning and memory
references.reason: This highly influential theoretical paper on the Complementary Learning Systems (CLS) theory provides the foundational theoretical framework for the memory-based mechanisms used in the MemVLT model.
